intro: Hibbertia circinata, commonly known as the spiral hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves around the stem. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Hibbertia circinata is a shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height, with hairy stems and elliptical leaves.
